organic_results.title: A comparative analysis of organizational conflict in schools
organic_results.snippet: Conflict is analyzed as a function of the organizational conditions of school size, teaching specialization, and the centralization of authority. The inter-relationships among these explanatory variables and two forms of organizational conflict are explored with data from thirty-eight elementary and fifteen secondary schools. Conflict is classified as either intra-or inter-stratum contingent upon the parties involved in the conflictual situation. A single theoretical model is developed, and then estimated separately for elementary and …
